bibl.title: Letter from Mrs. Carl Voegtlin to Laura Armistead Carter, September 18, 1925

div1.p: Voegtlin expresses her condolences upon the death of Henry Carter.

div1.head: Letter from Mrs. Carl Voegtlin to Laura Armistead Carter, September 18, 1925
div1.p:
I have only today heard
of your loss - and I hasten
to send you our very sincere
sympathy in the passing on
of one who was so very
dear to you-

And yet as he was
suffering and ill - surely
you need find a certain
consolation and quiet
happiness in the knowledge
that bodily ills are no longer a
part of his ordeal!

I know you are bears - and have
as you chief iof the realization
of the great happiness you were
in his daily life.

Dr. Voegtlin is on his way home
from Europe, but will feel the
same real sympathy for you
I know when he hears of Dr. Carter's
passing on.
